paragraphs.text: It may be awkward, but GPs owe it to obese patients to give weight loss advice.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: According to a study by researchers at King's College London, many doctors are failing to tackle their patients' weight problems
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Researchers analysed the records of several thousand obese patients and found that 80% of them had never talked to their GP about their weight
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: This finding comes in the same week as it was reported that diabetes, an obesity-related disease, is using up a tenth of the NHS budget and causing record numbers of complications
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: But
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: is fat a medical issue?
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Should nurses and GPs like me broach the subject?
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: And does intervention ever work?
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Some argue that obesity is a symptom of poverty and should be tackled at source
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: while government, schools and other agencies clearly have a role to play
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I don't see how GPs can ignore obesity when faced with it
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: There is no doubt that the 22% of men and 24% of women in the UK who are obese are at increased risk of several cancers, heart, liver and respiratory disease, dementia and diabetes
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: As a busy GP faced with an overflowing waiting room of ill people, it's tempting to avoid bringing up the subject
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I have to pick the right moment and phrase it sensitively
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: "Do you feel your weight is an issue?" and "Is there something we can do to help?" are good openers
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: there needs to be time to have the discussion
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I admit I often put it off
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: But
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: arguably, one obese person referred for life-changing bariatric surgery is a more useful intervention than seeing a room full of people with coughs and colds
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Not everyone is receptive
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Some say"I'm overweight but I am fitter than most people my age"
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Or "I know lots of thin people who have died young and fat people who are fine"
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: But these comments are the same as anecdotal tales of smokers who live to 100 and young non-smokers who die of lung cancer
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: We are talking about increased risk, not a guaranteed death sentence if you're obese or smoke and certain immortality if you're thin or a non-smoker
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: This sounds obvious
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it's funny how irrational many people are
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: especially if you're telling them something they don't want to hear
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I think GPs have a responsibility to initiate a conversation about obesity
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: because
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it is clear that it is an important health risk
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: overweight people often underestimate their weight
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: losing weight can reduce that risk
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: there are interventions that can help
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: For example
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: bariatric surgery, which is arguably the most effective way of keeping weight off, may cut the risk of developing type 2 diabetes by 80%
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: We also owe it to the next generation to intervene
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Most fat children have fat parents
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: most will become fat adults in turn
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: More than half of obese six- year-olds will become obese adults, compared with less than 10% of non-obese kids
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: And
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: having an obese parent doubles your risk of being an obese adult, even if you're a skinny child
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: So any intervention that helps a parent to tackle their obesity is likely to have a positive impact on the adults of the future
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: There is no need for doctors to be nihilistic and think it's not worth broaching the subject because nothing can be done
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: True, we don't know the most effective way of tackling obesity yet
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Europe-wide trials are ongoing to try to find out what that would be
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But there are options available: local council-run exercise programmes; referral to an NHS dietician; the prescription drug orlistat; or referral for bariatric surgery
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Last month, a new anti-obesity drug, Mysimba, was approved by the European Medicines Agency, and is likely to be available on prescription later this year, despite the reservations of some experts
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: There will be some GP consultations in which discussion about obesity just isn't appropriate or relevant
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: a person is devastated by a recent bereavement, for instance
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: it may be rude, crass, insensitive and offensive to mention their weight
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: And
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: having discussed the subject, there is no need to bang on about it at every visit
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: putting it off forever is an abrogation of a doctor's duty of care
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: A person may choose not to take up the doctor's offer to explore the problem
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: that's their right of course
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: But there's no excuse for not offering
paragraphs.label: assumption
